title: Macron says Ukraine peace must come with 'strong and credible security guarantees'
summary: European leaders held an emergency meeting in Paris on Monday to address Washington's shock policy shift on the war in Ukraine. The French president commented on the issue early Tuesday after a phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: Russia says 'no reason' to invite Europeans to Ukraine truce talks as top Russia, US officials to meet in Saudia Arabia
summary: Russian foreign minister Sergei Lavrov accused Europe of wanting to 'continue war' in Ukraine, as Russian and US officials prepare to meet in Saudi Arabia and European leaders convene in Paris for an emergency summit in response.

title: Donald Trump awakens Canadian patriotism
summary: The tariffs imposed by Washington and Trump's desire to make Canada the 51st American state are provoking a surge of national pride in the country, both economically and politically.

title: 'Cryptogate' in Argentina: Javier Milei in turmoil for encouraging the purchase of an obscure cryptocurrency
summary: The Argentine president, an economist to boot, encouraged the purchase of $Libra, the price of which immediately plummeted. The opposition has announced its intention to initiate impeachment proceedings.

title: Meloni consolidates popularity by disrupting Italian democracy
summary: The Italian leader could once have been described as 'against the system' – like the Brexiteers or the Trump of 2016. Today she is the system, and Italy's republican institutions are mere obstacles to be overcome.

title: Paris wants more visible police, less visible garbage
summary: Starting in March, each neighborhood in the French capital will have a dedicated police officer and, in the longer term, a dedicated sanitation agent. Two issues on which the opposition regularly attacks the municipal majority.

title: Delta plane flips upside down in Toronto crash, at least 15 wounded
summary: 80 people were on board the jet that crash-landed at Toronto airport on Monday. 'Initial reports were that there are no fatalities,' Delta Airlines said through a spokesperson's statement. Paramedic services said that 15 people were injured, including three critically – a child, a man in his 60s and a woman in her 40s.

title: 'The first time we've prepared for war in peacetime': Lithuania at the forefront of European defense
summary: As a result of the Russian threat, the Baltic state has decided to increase its military spending to 6% of its GDP by 2030.

title: Hamas maintains control in Gaza through surveillance and fear
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has stepped up the pressure on the Palestinian Islamist movement, but while a weakened Hamas may not pose a threat to Israel, no one in Gaza disputes its monopoly on power.

title: Arab summit on Trump's Gaza plan postponed and expanded
summary: A meeting of Arab leaders in response to the US president's plan to take control of the Gaza Strip, due to be held in Riyadh on Thursday, has been postponed by a day.

title: The multifaceted neo-Nazi threat in France
summary: On the wane in France, despite its renewed popularity in the West, neo-Nazi ideology has above all become a marker of adherence to the theses of the ultra right and an expression of radical violence.

title: Winter has been particularly gray in France. What are the health effects of a lack of sun?
summary: Missing the sun? That's normal. A lack of natural light has consequences on physical and mental health.

title: Pope's hospital stay extended, condition 'complex'
summary: After Pope Francis was originally hospitalized for bronchitis, the Vatican announced on Monday that the 88-year-old will require a longer stay/

title: France tries five suspected IS jihadists for abducting four reporters in Syria
summary: Mehdi Nemmouche is among five men accused of holding four French journalists hostage at a trial that started in Paris on Monday. Nemmouche is already in prison after a Belgian court jailed him for life in 2019 for killing four people at a Jewish museum in May 2014.

title: 'Greenlanders are by no means passive in the face of imperialism'
summary: After Donald Trump's repeated talks about buying the territory, geographer Marine Duc explains that sticking to hegemonic clichés and downplaying the indigenous populations' agency would be a mistake.

title: NBA All-Star Game: a conquering Victor Wembanyama fails to make the finals
summary: The French player, making his All-Star Game debut, lost to a team of veterans such as Stephen Curry. However, he stood out with his determination in a game where many of his teammates took a more relaxed approach.

title: Bird flu: As the epidemic worsens, the US will import eggs from Turkey
summary: Over three years, the spread of the H5N1 virus has forced American farms to cull 158 million turkeys, chickens and laying hens.

title: After Goma, DRC's Bukavu falls under M23 rebels' control
summary: The armed group, backed by several thousand Rwandan soldiers, has taken the capital of South Kivu province. It continues to advance, despite calls for a ceasefire from the African Union and threats of sanctions.

title: UK ready to send troops to Ukraine, while Germany says discussion of deployment 'premature'
summary: As European leaders hold war talks in Paris, Keir Starmer said he was willing to put 'our own troops on the ground if necessary'. Sweden said it would not rule out sending troops, while Poland ruled this out and Germany said it would 'wait and see'.

title: In the Amazon, the 'cocaine rivers' plague the region
summary: Since Brazil stepped up its fight against illegal air transport, drug traffickers who transport drugs from producer countries to the Atlantic seaboard are increasingly using Amazonian waterways.

title: New York City Council calls for under-fire mayor's resignation
summary: Mayor Eric Adams, who pleaded not guilty in September to charges of fraud and bribery, has denied allegations that he asked for the case to be dropped in exchange for enforcing Trump's immigration agenda. On Monday, four NYC deputy mayors indicated they would be resigning, plunging local politics into further chaos.

title: Humanitarian effort in Syria decimated by US aid cuts
summary: The assistance provided in Syria by Washington accounted for a quarter of international funding in 2024, and its suspension by the Trump administration has halted programs in critical areas including health and food security.

title: Costa Rica says will receive deported migrants from US
summary: Costa Rica is the third country in Central America to collaborate on repatriating deported migrants from the US since President Trump assumed office. Panama and Guatemala had previously agreed to a similar arrangement when US Secretary of State Marco Rubio visited on a recent tour of Latin America.

title: Paris exhibition brings Gaza's saved archaeological heritage back into the spotlight
summary: In April, an exhibition will showcase some 100 'miraculously saved' artifacts that have been stored in Geneva since 2007.

title: Argentina's Milei denies role in 'cryptogate' as prosecutors launch probe
summary: Argentina's federal prosecutor's office will examine whether Milei engaged in fraud or criminal association or was in breach of his duties when he praised the $LIBRA cryptocurrency on social media Friday evening. The currency's value soared then crashed, losing investors billions of dollars.

title: In the UK, the cost of death has never been higher
summary: Funerals are becoming increasingly expensive across the Channel. Some relatives are opting for crowdfunding to cover the costs, or for low-cost cremations.

title: War in Ukraine: Europeans, marginalized by Trump and Putin, prove divided over sending troops
summary: Emmanuel Macron brought together eight European leaders and the heads of NATO and EU bodies in a mini-summit at the Elysée on Monday, less than a week after Washington and Moscow agreed to begin 'immediate' negotiations to end the conflict.

title: US-Russia talks begin in Saudi with no seat for Ukraine
summary: The meeting is a key move by the Trump administration to end Russia's isolation and set the stage for a Trump-Putin summit.

title: Israel remains in five locations in Lebanon despite withdrawal deadline
summary: Despite Tuesday's deadline for a full withdrawal, Israel continues to occupy five key high points in southern Lebanon, citing security concerns. Lebanon has condemned the move as an 'occupation' and is seeking UN intervention to enforce a complete pullout.

title: Musk has no formal decision-making authority, says White House
summary: A court filing from a case brought by 14 US states against Elon Musk, seen as the de facto head of the Department of Government Efficiency following an announcement by Donald Trump, confirms that he does not have authority to make government decisions.

title: US deports Indian migrants in embarrassing setback for Modi
summary: A second group of men, women and minors was repatriated, two days after the Indian prime minister's visit to Washington.

title: 'I should be behind bars in Moscow': Navalny's exiled lawyer on the twist of fate that brought her to Paris
summary: A lawyer for the late Alexei Navalny, the most famous of Vladimir Putin's opponents, Olga Mikhailova is a refugee in France, while three of her colleagues are serving prison sentences in Russia.

title: Vatican cancels Pope's weekend events, but says he is eating, reading
summary: Pope Francis, 88, hospitalized in Rome since last Friday, was described by the Vatican as having 'had breakfast' and 'reading some newspapers as he regularly does' by Vatican officials, after canceling his Holy Year weekend events for health reasons.

title: Covid-19: How a group of amateur investigators pushed the lab-leak theory
summary: For the past five years, DRASTIC, a group of internet users with no expertise in virology, has been pushing their hypothesis of a research accident in a Chinese laboratory. Once branded as conspiracy theorists, they now have the attention of the World Health Organization and the US government.

title: Algeria slams French culture minister's visit to Western Sahara
summary: After Rachida Dati's 'historic' trip, an Algerian foreign ministry statement posted on social media on Tuesday said the visit 'reflects blatant disregard for international legality by a permanent member of the UN Security Council.'.

title: Scratching aggravates inflammation but boosts antibacterial immunity
summary: Scratching promotes inflammatory processes in the case of contact allergy. However, it also boosts defenses against staphylococcus aureus, according to a study in 'Science.'

title: Musk has become focus of anti-Trump demonstrators' anger
summary: Thousands of people demonstrated across the country, on Monday, against the dismissal of federal employees, lack of respect for checks and balances and the richest man in the world's influence on the White House.

title: Restricting jus soli in France to limit immigration doesn't make sense
summary: Every year, just over 30,000 children born in France to foreign-born parents become French citizens when they turn 18. This legal principle has long been contested on the right.

title: Sarkozy's trial: A timely twist from the former president's lawyers
summary: Following the former president's co-defendant Claude Guéant's convoluted justifications for renting a gigantic safe to store documents during the 2007 presidential campaign, Sarkozy's defense team produced a previously unpublished recording of one of his conversations with the Libyan leader.

title: Trump attacks climate science and spreads fear among scientists
summary: Erasing references to climate change, censoring environmental data and undermining globally recognized agencies... The Trump administration is leading an unprecedented offensive.

title: Five garden paradises on the French Riviera to visit all year round
summary: This is a region richly endowed with exceptional gardens and lush vegetation. Ideal for temporarily escaping the grayness of winter.

title: The frustrations of European countries not invited to emergency Ukraine talks in Paris
summary: Only seven European countries were invited to the summit on Ukraine and European security at the Elysée Palace on Monday, prompting disappointment and criticism, particularly from the Czech Republic and Romania.

title: Macron says Trump 'can restart useful dialogue' with Putin
summary: The French president, who once spoke regularly to Putin but has held no talks with him since 2022, said he is ready to speak to his Russian counterpart 'when it is appropriate in the cycle of upcoming negotiations.'
